conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the blocks and apply Newton's second law.
Two wooden blocks A and B are connected by a light spring.
Identify forces on block A: applied force F (upward), gravitational force m_A g (downward), spring force F_spring (downward).
Identify forces on block B: gravitational force m_B g (downward), spring force F_spring (upward).
Apply Newton's second law to block A: F = m_A g + k x_0.
Apply Newton's second law to block B: k x_0 = m_B g.
Find initial spring compression x_0: x_0 = m_B g / k.
Substitute x_0 into block A's equation: F = m_A g + m_B g.
Find initial acceleration of block A: F - (m_A g + m_B g) = 0, so a = 0.
The magnitude of the initial acceleration of block A is 0.
